Text:
i hope this update is not mandatory..
ie. it's not required for online safety and stealth purposes.
coz i dont wanna take my 360 again to some pro to flash my lite-on drive from lt+ to lt+ 1.1

Well, better PFI support i think means you may be able to use other discs and the other update is just improved back-up support, so unless those would be beneficial to you im not sure i'd bother. Wondering if this update has any added stealth though ....
edit* Back-up support fororiginal XBOX games

From C4E

[2010-12-15 08:23PM UTC] #fw  c4eva, was there security vulnerabilities in lt+ 1.0 for liteon seen update for PFI scanning came quickly?
[2010-12-15 08:24PM UTC] #fw  1.1 isnt a security fix
[2010-12-15 08:24PM UTC] #fw  xbox1 compat and pfi enhancements
[2010-12-15 08:25PM UTC] #fw  yea I understand that, just thought surely pfi enhancements could be justified as making the fw more rounded and secure
[2010-12-15 08:25PM UTC] #fw  will i be ok if I just stick with LT+ 1.0 ?
[2010-12-15 08:25PM UTC] #fw  yes
[2010-12-15 08:26PM UTC] #fw  pfi to give better reading of disks,no security holes!


----So in other words, its not necessary thank goodness.  Didn't want to have to take my 360 apart again after I just put it back together.  Its just to allow xbox 1 backups and cheaper disks.
what about LT+ for samsung who know?

@Kain

ALL samsung drives DOES not have AP.25 so LT+ is not required stick with the ixtreme firmware you got
